message.content:
You can use the following regex expression to extract the three character code:

`(?<=-)(?=.*\.usfm$)[a-zA-Z0-9]{3}`

Here's a breakdown of how it works:

* `(?<=-)`: This is a positive lookbehind assertion that ensures the match is preceded by a hyphen (`-`). This anchors the match to start after the hyphen.
* `(?=.*\.usfm$)`: This is a positive lookahead assertion that ensures the match is followed by ".usfm" at the end of the string. This anchors the match to end with ".usfm".
* `[a-zA-Z0-9]{3}`: This matches exactly 3 characters that are either uppercase letters (`[A-Z]`), lowercase letters (`[a-z]`) or digits (`[0-9]`). The `^` at the start and `$` at the end of the character class ensure that all 3 characters must match this pattern.

Here's an example in Python:

```
import re

filename = "57-1Jn.usfm"
match = re.search(r'(?<=-)(?=.*\.usfm$)[a-zA-Z0-9]{3}', filename)
if match:
    print(match.group())  # Output: '1Jn'
else:
    print("No match found")
```

This will extract the three character code "1Jn" from the filename.
